item.title: 雪佛龙对收购菲利普斯 66 化学股份持开放态度
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，雪佛龙公司有意收购菲利普斯 66 在一家化工合资企业中的股份，而激进分子埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management LP）正推动这家炼油企业退出该合资企业。【原文：Chevron Corp. is interested in buying Phillips 66’s stake in a chemicals joint venture that activist Elliott Investment Management LP is pushing the oil refiner to exit, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 禽流感导致鸡蛋价格飙升，美国将增加鸡蛋进口，缓解农场压力
item.description: 美国正在加强鸡蛋进口，并加大对养鸡户的支持力度，以应对有史以来最严重的禽流感疫情，禽流感疫情已使鸡蛋价格创下每打超过 8 美元的纪录。【原文：The US is stepping up egg imports and boosting support to chicken farmers to combat its worst-ever outbreak of avian flu that’s sent egg prices to a record of over $8 a dozen.】

item.title: 特朗普的大局观经济学家已让华尔街上钩
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统想要瓦解全球经济秩序，这已不是什么秘密。华尔街向斯蒂芬-米兰（Stephen Miran）寻求线索。【原文：It’s no secret that President Donald Trump wants to dismantle the global economic order. Less clear is what he’ll try to build in its place — and Wall Street has turned to Stephen Miran for clues.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的 Shalett 说：大型科技公司退潮带来选股良机
item.description: 近年来，大科技股的一枝独秀让选股人苦不堪言。摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的丽莎-沙利特（Lisa Shalett）认为，随着大科技股从巅峰跌落两位数，发掘下一个市场先锋的机会出现了。【原文：The monolithic dominance of Big Tech made life miserable for stock pickers in recent years. With the group reaching a double-digit drop from its peak, opportunities to uncover the next market vanguards have arisen, according to Morgan Stanley’s Lisa Shalett.】

item.title: 亚马逊推出期待已久的人工智能版 Alexa 语音助手
item.description: 亚马逊公司用人工智能重启了 Alexa。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. has rebooted Alexa with artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 优步竞争对手博尔特为潜在 IPO 物色顾问
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Bolt Technology OU 正在与一家顾问公司合作，探讨包括潜在的首次公开募股在内的各种方案。【原文：Bolt Technology OU is working with an adviser to explore options including a potential initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 马拉维总统因价格抗议解雇贸易部长
item.description: 马拉维总统拉扎罗斯-查克韦拉（Lazarus Chakwera）解雇了他的贸易部长，此前一天，这个贫困的南部非洲国家首都爆发了生活费用危机抗议活动。【原文：Malawian President Lazarus Chakwera fired his trade minister, a day after protests erupted in the capital over a cost-of-living crisis in the poverty-stricken southern African nation.】

item.title: 英国大臣表示，英国正就富裕外国人纳税问题进行 "公开对话
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在去年的预算案中对所谓的 "非英国户籍"（non-dom）制度进行了新一轮的打击，在此之后，英国一直在与外国富豪讨论他们在英国的纳税问题。【原文：The UK is in ongoing discussions with wealthy foreigners about the taxes they pay in Britain, following a backlash against a fresh crackdown on the so-called non-dom regime introduced by Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves at last year’s budget.】

item.title: 受利率和风暴影响，美国新房销售降至三个月低点
item.description: 今年年初，美国的新房销售量跌至三个月来的最低点，这反映了经济承受能力方面的挑战以及严酷的冬季天气。【原文：New-home sales in the US fell at the start of the year to a three-month low, reflecting a combination of affordability challenges as well as harsh winter weather.】

item.title: 父子仇杀令新加坡最富有家族陷入危机
item.description: 据称有人企图在董事会上发动政变，家族族长与儿子之间的诉讼，以及对公司治理失误的指控—；即使以亚洲接班人戏剧的标准来看，新加坡郭氏家族的家族争斗也显得格外突出。【原文：An alleged boardroom coup attempt, a lawsuit between a family patriarch and his son, and accusations of corporate governance lapses — even by the standards of Asian succession drama, the family feud raging at Singapore’s Kwek dynasty stands out.】

item.title: Couche-Tard 仍在寻求七项收购；I 交易，获取财务信息
item.description: 知情人士称，Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.正继续追逐 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. is keeping up its pursuit of Seven & i Holdings Co. but has yet to gain access to the Japanese company’s financials, months after proposing a takeover, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 赝品和邪教谋杀：Memecoin 家族的曲折往事
item.description: 南美最大国家之一的总统卷入加密货币丑闻，这并不是戴维斯家族成员第一次成为争议的焦点。【原文：Being in the middle of the crypto scandal that’s ensnared the president of one of South America’s biggest countries wasn’t the first time that members of the Davis family found themselves at the center of controversy.】

item.title: 国债投资者预计美联储将重新关注经济增长风险
item.description: 美国政府债券的投资者开始打赌，美联储很快就会从担心通胀持续高企转为担心经济增长放缓。【原文：Investors in US government bonds are starting to bet the Federal Reserve will soon need to pivot from worrying about sticky inflation to fretting about slowing economic growth.】

item.title: 电动汽车销量停滞不前，梅赛德斯开发新型 V8 内燃机
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰集团（Mercedes-Benz Group AG）正在开发一种新型内燃机，成为因销售低迷而放慢电动汽车推进速度的最新一家汽车制造商。【原文：Mercedes-Benz Group AG is developing a new combustion engine, becoming the latest automaker to slow its electric-car push in response to sluggish sales.】

item.title: 做空者瞄准 2024 年最热门科技股，AppLovin 下跌 14
item.description: 两家做空机构发布了有关 AppLovin 公司的报告，导致这家为应用程序开发商提供营销服务的公司股价下跌高达 14%。【原文：Two short sellers released reports on AppLovin Corp, touching off a rout of as much as 14% in shares of the company that provides marketing services to app developers.】

item.title: 乌克兰无人机袭击俄罗斯图阿普谢炼油厂和主要港口
item.description: 乌克兰无人机袭击了俄罗斯南部的一个主要海港以及俄罗斯石油公司的图阿普谢炼油厂，可能会影响燃料出口。【原文：Ukrainian drones attacked a major sea port in southern Russia as well as Rosneft PJSC’s Tuapse oil refinery, potentially affecting fuel exports.】

item.title: FTX 9.5 亿美元的破产费用是雷曼事件以来最昂贵的费用之一
item.description: FTX 的破产成本接近 10 亿美元，使 Sam Bankman-Fried 的加密货币企业的破产成为美国历史上破产保护成本最高的案件之一。【原文：The cost of FTX’s bankruptcy is approaching $1 billion, cementing the implosion of Sam Bankman-Fried’s crypto enterprise as one of costliest Chapter 11 cases in US history.】

item.title: 每月有十亿人在 YouTube 上观看播客
item.description:
该视频网站已超越 Spotify，成为美国最受欢迎的播客平台

。【原文：

The video site has leapfrogged Spotify to become the most popular podcasting platform in the US

】

item.title: 印度 Glance 公司深化与谷歌的合作，增加人工智能内容
item.description: 印度移动内容提供商Glance正在加深与支持者谷歌的联系，寻求利用这家美国互联网巨头在人工智能生成方面的专长来开发新的应用程序。【原文：Indian mobile-content provider Glance is deepening its ties with backer Google, seeking to tap the US internet giant’s expertise in generative artificial intelligence to build new apps.】

item.title: 巴克莱分析师预测劳埃德将获得巨额资本回报
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）的分析师认为，劳埃德银行集团（Lloyds Banking Group Plc）的基本面 "非常好，不容忽视"，他们预测这家英国银行到 2027 年将向股东返还近一半的市值。【原文：The fundamentals on offer at Lloyds Banking Group Plc are “too good to ignore,” according to Barclays Plc analysts, who predict the UK bank could return almost half of its market value to shareholders by 2027.】

item.title: 加纳可可运抵量增长 70%，原因是收成较好，走私受到打击
item.description: 加纳的可可入库量比上一季度增长了约 70%，这主要得益于收成的增加，以及这个第二大可可豆生产国为减少走私所做的努力。【原文：Ghana’s cocoa deliveries to warehouses are running roughly 70% ahead of last season helped by an increased harvest and efforts to reduce smuggling in the second-biggest producer of the bean.】

item.title: 澳大利亚首次购房者的抵押贷款压力激增
item.description: 据澳大利亚房地产咨询公司Domain Holdings Australia Ltd.称，由于利率仍然居高不下，房价居高不下，澳大利亚大多数大城市都报告称首次购房者的抵押贷款压力很大。【原文：Most major Australian cities are reporting mortgage stress among first-time home buyers due to still-elevated interest rates and ultra-high prices, according to property consultancy Domain Holdings Australia Ltd.】

item.title: 埃尔德里奇信贷臂为英国学生公寓贷款 2 亿英镑
item.description: 学生公寓提供商维塔集团控股有限公司（Vita Group Holdings Ltd.）已从埃尔德里奇资本管理公司（Eldridge Capital Management）的房地产信贷部门获得超过 2 亿英镑（2.54 亿美元）的债务融资，用于在伦敦金丝雀码头区建造一座 48 层的高楼。【原文：Student housing provider Vita Group Holdings Ltd. has secured more than £200 million ($254 million) in debt financing from Eldridge Capital Management’s real estate credit arm to build a 48-story tower in London’s Canary Wharf neighborhood.】

item.title: 英伟达的人工智能热潮为戴尔等合作伙伴带来了财富，但也付出了代价
item.description: 当戴尔科技公司（Dell Technologies Inc. ）完成向埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 xAI 初创公司供应服务器的 50 亿美元交易时，这将标志着这家拥有 40 年历史的计算机销售商取得了巨大的胜利。【原文：When Dell Technologies Inc. completes a $5 billion deal to supply servers to Elon Musk’s xAI startup, it will mark an immense win for the 40-year-old computer seller.】

item.title: 巴菲特选择日本贸易公司为特朗普提供对冲
item.description:
崇光商社的多元化投资组合可能有助于投资者抵御美国总统贸易政策引发的市场动荡。【原文：

The diverse portfolios of the Sogo Shosha may help shield investors from some of the market turbulence sparked by the US president’s trade policies.

】

item.title: GE Vernova 和 NRG 将为人工智能建造 5 千兆瓦天然气发电厂
item.description: GE Vernova 公司、NRG 能源公司和 Kiewit 公司签署了一项协议，将开发多达 5.4 千兆瓦的燃气发电厂，因为能源行业预计人工智能将导致电力需求激增。【原文：GE Vernova Inc., NRG Energy Inc. and Kiewit Corp. have signed an agreement to develop up to 5.4 gigawatts of gas-fired power plants as the energy industry anticipates a surge in electricity demand from artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 据说葡萄牙将在三月中旬获得有关 TAP 的估值报告
item.description: 葡萄牙政府预计将在 3 月中旬之前收到两份关于 TAP SA 估值的独立报告，这是推进这家国有航空公司私有化的关键一步。【原文：Portugal’s government is expected to receive two independent reports on the valuation of TAP SA by the middle of March, a key step before moving ahead with the privatization of the state-owned carrier.】

item.title: 马约尔称欧洲央行寻求加快银行资本模型审批速度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行的一位高级官员表示，该监管机构正在努力加快评估贷款机构对其财务实力的计算，这一举措可能会改善与该行业的紧张关系。【原文：A top European Central Bank official said the watchdog is working to speed up its assessments of lenders’ calculations of their financial strength, a step that may improve strained relations with the industry.】

item.title: 欧洲夏季天然气溢价因乌克兰谈判和天气原因而下降
item.description: 随着对供应前景以及结束乌克兰战争的谈判的乐观情绪升温，欧洲今年夏季交付的天然气价格终于接近明年冬季的价格，而溢价正趋向于零。【原文：European natural gas for delivery this summer is finally getting closer to prices for next winter — with the premium inching toward zero — as optimism rises about the supply outlook as well as talks to end the war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 肯尼亚向投资者提供 10.5% 的收益率以转换为较长期的债务
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，肯尼亚正在向投资者提供约 10.5% 的收益率，让他们将较短期的债券换成 2036 年到期的新债券，以平滑其债务状况。【原文：Kenya is offering investors a yield of around 10.5% to swap out of shorter-dated bonds into new notes with a 2036 maturity as the country seeks to smooth out its debt profile, according to people familiar with the matter.】
